text: Measles , RB called rubeola , is a viral infection WDT 's CD of DT most contagious infectious diseases in DT NN . DT NN is marked by symptoms WDT are similar to a common cold , as well as a characteristic red rash . Between 2000 and 2010 , DT JJ incidence of measles decreased by 66 % and DT mortality caused by DT NN decreased 74 % , according to a report published in DT journal DT Lancet . Less than two decades ago , measles was almost wiped out in DT NNP NNPS , thanks to NNS . But recently , DT NN has had a resurgence . Globally , DT number of NNS has jumped 30 % due to NN hesitancy . More than 760 NNS of measles were reported in DT U.S. between Jan. 1 and NNP 3 , 2019 , according to Dr. Deepa Mukundan , a pediatric infectious diseases specialist at DT University of Toledo NNP Center in Ohio . This is up from 372 NNS over DT entire NN in 2018 and up from 120 NNS over DT entire NN in 2017 , according to DT Centers for NNP Control and Prevention ( CDC ) . How contagious is PRP ? Measles is caused by Measles morbillivirus , a NN in DT paramyxoviridae family . According to DT CDC , DT measles NN settles in DT nose and throat mucus of an infected person . When a person infected with DT NN coughs , sneezes or exhales , DT NN becomes airborne and can spread to other NNS . " DT NN can remain in DT air for significant periods of NN , " Mukundan told Live NNP . " PRP can VB DT measles just by being in a room where a person with measles has been , even up to 2 hours after DT person has left . " Indeed , DT NN is incredibly contagious — 90 % of NNS who are not vaccinated against measles will become infected if PRP share space with someone who has DT NN . " Another reason IN PRP is transmitted so effectively is because DT hallmark of measles , DT rash , only comes several days after someone is contagious , " VBD Dr. Jennifer Lighter , a pediatric infectious NN specialist at NNP York University Langone NNP . Therefore , infected individuals can spread DT NN for several days before realizing PRP 're ill . DT contagious period lasts about four days before and four days after DT rash appears . A person with measles is likely to infect between 5 and 18 unvaccinated NNS , according to a 2019 review published in DT journal Emerging Infectious Diseases . Most NNS of measles cause some combination of cough , runny nose , red eyes , high fever and tiny white to bluish spots in DT mouth , VBD Dr. Aileen M. Marty , a professor of infectious diseases at Florida International University 's Herbert Wertheim College of Medicine in Miami . As DT infection progresses , DT characteristic red rash will develop . DT rash typically looks IN large , red , flat splotches on DT skin . To test for measles , a doctor will examine DT patient for telltale symptoms , such as spots inside of DT mouth and DT skin rash . If DT doctor has any doubt , PRP MD order a blood test to confirm infection , according to DT Mayo Clinic . Almost all NNS require treatment by a doctor . " This is a NN where complications are common — complications such as ear infection ( acute otitis NN ) , diarrhea and dehydration , pneumonia , encephalitis and even death , " Marty told Live NNP . " In DT NNP NNPS , CD to three of every 1,000 infected persons will die from [ measles ] complications — which is better than in DT Third NNP , where as JJ as two to 15 per 100 infected persons die from measles and its complications . " Young NNS are much more susceptible to DT NN . According to DT Mayo Clinic , measles kills 100,000 NNS a NN , most under DT age of 5 . Pregnant women and those with a compromised immune system are RB at risk of severe complications . EX is no specific drug for treating measles . Instead , doctors treat DT symptoms . " This means PRP provide / advise hydration , antipyretics ( e.g. , acetaminophen ) for comfort and fever control , airway humidification in patients with respiratory tract involvement , " Marty VBD . Though not licensed in DT NNP NNPS for DT treatment of measles , some pediatricians have used Ribavirin , an antiviral medication , to treat severe pneumonia caused by measles , Marty added . To protect those who have been exposed to DT NN but have not been vaccinated , a doctor MD order a post - exposure NN . If given within 72 hours of exposure , DT NN MD prevent DT measles . Even if PRP does n't prevent DT NN , DT vaccinated patient will only have a mild case of DT measles , according to DT Mayo Clinic . Another way to protect at - risk individuals is to inject them with immune serum globulin ( antibodies or proteins derived from DT blood of donors with measles immunity ) within six days of exposure to DT NN . IN a NN , this treatment can prevent measles or make DT onset less severe . For JJ NNS , recovering from DT measles includes resting at home until DT symptoms subside . PRP is important for patients to drink plenty of fluids to replace fluids lost during fevers . PRP MD RB be helpful to use a humidifier to relieve congestion and to block out bright lights WDT MD bother sensitive eyes , according to DT Mayo Clinic . Once DT NN has run its course , DT person will be immune to DT NN . However , DT immune system MD be significantly weakened for up to 2 NNS after recovering from DT measles , according to Lighter . During this NN , NNS can be more susceptible to secondary viral and bacterial infections , which MD cause more complications than DT original measles infection . DT best way to prevent measles is by NN . DT CDC recommends 2 doses of DT NN ; DT first for those between 12 and 15 months of age and DT second for NNS between 4 and 6 NNS of age . DT NN is 97 % effective for those who receive both doses and about 93 % effective for those receiving CD . Getting DT proper vaccinations not only protects DT individual receiving DT NN , PRP RB protects those who cannot be vaccinated : those allergic to components of DT NN , those with a compromised immune system or those too young to receive DT NN . " NNS are CD of DT most effective tools PRP have to protect JJ NN and prevent deaths around DT NN , " VBD Dr. Scott Lillibridge , an infectious NN expert and professor at DT Texas A&M NNP NNP Center School of NNP NNP . About 94 % of DT U.S. population is vaccinated against measles , according to Mukundan , although EX are pockets of NNS who delay or refuse NNS . DT groups of unvaccinated NNS make PRP difficult to control DT spread of measles , she VBD . " All measles outbreaks in DT U.S. start either with a visiting international traveler infected with measles or from an unvaccinated U.S. resident returning from an international trip with a measles infection , " Mukundan VBD . DT infection is then spread to others in DT community who are unvaccinated . Most measles NNS occur in locations with groups of unvaccinated individuals , according to DT CDC . In 2000 , DT U.S. declared IN measles was effectively eliminated in DT country . But since then , DT NN has been making a comeback , likely due to anti-vaxxers . " DT antivax movement is a small percentage of DT population but PRP are loud and draw a lot of undue NN attention , " Lighter VBD . Anti-vaxxers are driven by emotion rather than DT NN behind DT NNS , she VBD . Modern opposition to NNS is largely fueled by religious beliefs and DT unwarranted concern IN NNS are somehow linked to NN , among other reasons , according to DT Measles & Rubella Initiative , a collaboration of DT NN 's largest NN organizations WDT aims to eliminate measles and rubella . Before DT measles NN approval in 1963 , an estimated 3 to 4 million NNS in DT U.S. contracted DT measles per NN , with 400 to 500 dying from complications , according to DT CDC . Introduction of DT NN led to a greater than 99 % reduction in measles NNS in DT U.S. A wealth of research has confirmed IN EX is no relationship between NNS and NN and has repeatedly validated DT safety of DT measles NN . " Protect yourself and your loved ones by making sure IN PRP are up to date on DT measles NN , " Mukundan VBD . " Prevention , meaning NN , is always better than cure . text: DT WHITE HOUSE Office of DT Press Secretary NNP NNP Unveils Millennium Initiative to Promote Delivery of Existing NNPS in Developing NNS and Accelerate Development of NNP NNPS In his NN of DT Union address , NNP NNP will call for concerted international action to combat infectious diseases in developing NNS . These diseases cause almost half of all deaths worldwide of NNS under age 45 , killing over eight million NNS each NN and orphaning millions more . DT NNP committed DT NNP NNPS to addressing this terrible problem in his September speech to DT NNP Nations General Assembly . Now DT NNP is asking for foundations , pharmaceutical companies , international agencies , and other governments to join PRP in this task , and he is announcing these specific elements of his Millennium Initiative : • A JJ financial commitment to purchase and deliver existing NNS in poor NNS . As Vice NNP Gore told DT U. N. Security Council earlier this month , DT Administration�s FY 2001 budget will include a proposed $ 50 million contribution to DT NN purchase fund of DT NNP Alliance for NNPS and Immunization ( GAVI ) . • Increased investments in NN in developing NNS . DT NNP is calling on DT NNP Bank and other multilateral development banks to dedicate an additional $ 400 million to $ 900 million annually of their low - interest - rate loans to expand immunization , prevent and treat infectious diseases , and build effective delivery systems for other basic NN services . These investments are as central to JJ progress as investments in education and physical infrastructure , and PRP MD build on DT JJ focus on basic NN services WDT PRP have supported as part of DT Highly Indebted Poor NNPS ( HIPC ) debt initiative . This proposed shift in existing resources does not require additional U.S. budget expenditures . • A significant increase in basic research on diseases WDT affect developing nations . DT Administration�s FY 2001 budget for DT National Institutes of NNP includes a sharp step - up in research critical to DT development of NNS for malaria , tuberculosis , and HIV / AIDS . • A JJ tax credit for sales of NNS for malaria , tuberculosis , and HIV / AIDS to accelerate DT invention and production of these NNS . Because developing NNS often cannot afford to buy NNS , DT market provides little incentive for pharmaceutical companies to develop NNS for diseases WDT disproportionately affect those NNS . This tax credit MD provide such an incentive , because every dollar paid by a qualifying organization to buy a qualifying NN MD be matched by a dollar of tax credits � representing up to $ 1 billion of additional funding for future NN purchases . DT NNP is calling on other governments to make similar purchase commitments , so IN PRP can ensure a future market for these critically needed NNS . Infectious Diseases Pose a Mounting Social and JJ Burden on Developing NNS � And a Threat to Our NN As Well . • More than eight million NNS die each NN of centuries - old diseases IN malaria , tuberculosis , and respiratory and diarrheal diseases . Deaths from DT modern scourge of AIDS are climbing rapidly . Altogether , as JJ NNS die of infectious diseases each NN as DT total number of combatants who perished in NNP War I . • In an interconnected and highly mobile NN , NN crises in other NNS are a threat to everyone . PRP have seen this with HIV / AIDS , with DT resurfacing of tuberculosis , and with DT outbreak last NN of West Nile encephalitis in NNP York . According to DT NNP NNP Council , during DT past 50 NNS , at least five times as JJ Americans have died from communicable diseases WDT have come from DT developing NN than have died in military conflicts . NNS Are CD of DT Most Cost - Effective Ways to Improve DT Well - Being and Productivity of DT Poorest NNS � And Medicines and Other Basic NN Services Are a Necessary Complement . • PRP costs about $ 17 to immunize a child , but millions of NNS die each NN of diseases WDT MD be prevented by existing NNS . Indeed , NNS in developing nations are 10 times more likely to die of a NN - preventable NN than NNS in developed nations . And these tragedies occur in spite of DT enormous efforts of UNICEF and others to vaccinate NNS , which save 3 million lives each NN . • Highly effective NNS do not yet exist for malaria , TB and AIDS , which take over 5 million lives each NN . But developed nations have DT scientific and technological capacity to make JJ NNS possible . For example , recent work on genetic sequencing , including DT human genome , will open vast possibilities . • Another NN investment with very high returns is simple preventive and curative services . Providing this basic NN care together with NNS MD save millions of lives each NN . A $ 50 Million Contribution to GAVI to Buy NNS For NNS � Which Will Save Lives Now and Create Confidence WDT a Market for JJ NNS Will Exist in DT Future . • GAVI , DT NNP Alliance for NNPS and Immunization , was formed as a collaborative effort of UNICEF , DT NNP NNP Organization ( WHO ) , DT NNP Bank , private foundations , bilateral aid agencies ( including DT U.S. Agency for International Development ) , industry representatives , and developing NNS . GAVI established DT � NNP Fund for Children�s NNPS � with an initial grant of $ 750 million over 5 NNS from DT Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation . DT formal launch of GAVI , and DT official announcement of DT Gates gift , will occur shortly in Davos , Switzerland . • A U.S. contribution will help to purchase NNS for Hepatitis B , Haemophilus Influenzae B ( Hib ) , and Yellow Fever , along with related safe delivery equipment such as auto - destruct syringes . To ensure IN GAVI�s NN purchases complement , rather than replace , existing NN efforts , PRP will be conditional on a country achieving 50 percent coverage of DT DTP ( diptheria - tetanus - pertussis ) NN , which is included along with measles and polio in DT existing EPI ( Expanded Program for Immunization ) . • A U.S. contribution will hopefully catalyze significant contributions from other NNS and foundations . PRP will RB add crucial credibility to DT international community�s commitment to provide a market for JJ NNS when PRP are developed . PRP Must Shift Existing International Resources Toward Building NNP Infrastructure in Poor NNPS WDT Can Deliver NNS and Medicines and Provide Essential Basic NNP Services . • DT NNP Bank and other multilateral development banks ( MDBs , such as DT African Development Fund ) lend money on highly favorable terms to DT world�s poorest NNS . Today , roughly $ 1 billion to $ 1 - 1/ 2 billion of this so - called � concessional funding � is devoted to NN care each NN . DT Administration proposes to increase DT amount by $ 400 million to $ 900 million per NN , with a focus on : • prevention of diseases using basic measures such as information and condoms for AIDS , treated bed nets for malaria , and stronger systems for containing TB ; • treatment of diseases , including common respiratory and diarrheal infections ; and • DT Administration is exploring ways to use DT HIPC debt reform to support this part of DT Millennium Initiative . CD possibility is to make an increase in NN rates CD of DT performance targets monitored in DT HIPC progress reports . This MD be accompanied by debtor NNS � agreements to include specific improvements in NN delivery systems as priority uses of debt relief proceeds . PRP RB expect IN all Poverty Reduction Strategy Papers WDT are prepared for HIPC candidates will discuss DT adequacy of budget resources and suggested policy reforms devoted to basic NN care . • This re-direction of resources supports DT Administration�s overall strategy for JJ development , which emphasizes poverty reduction and gives a central role to �global JJ goods � � IN NN or DT environment � in which positive actions taken in CD country benefit other NNS as well . To meet this objective , these funds should not come from spending on other basic social programs , such as education and NN care . • This aspect of DT Millennium Initiative does not require a JJ budgetary commitment by DT NNP NNPS ( or other donor NNS ) . However , DT U.S. ability to influence DT direction of MDB lending and DT use of HIPC proceeds depends crucially on meeting our existing commitments to these aid programs . PRP will work with other G - 8 finance and development ministries to refine this proposal . • A conservative estimate suggests IN if basic NN care including immunization were made broadly available , up to 2 million children�s lives MD be saved each NN . Higher Funding for Basic Scientific Research Through DT National Institutes of NNP ( NIH ) and Elsewhere Will Hasten DT Development of NNS for Malaria , TB , and AIDS . • DT Administration�s FY 2001 budget for NIH includes a significant increase in research critical to creating NNS for these diseases . For malaria and TB , this increase will build on recent advances in DT genetic sequencing of these diseases , which have set DT stage for major breakthroughs in NN development . • Funding for NIH malaria NN research will increase more than 10 percent over DT FY 2000 level . Future research will range from pre-clinical studies aimed at improving our understanding of DT malaria parasite , through DT development of NN candidates , to clinical trials judging NN efficacy and safety . NIH will RB expand its collaboration with NNS in malaria - endemic regions , especially in Africa , to strengthen those regions � capacity for conducting clinical trials of malaria NNS in DT future . • NIH research on a tuberculosis NN will receive over 40 percent more funding than in FY 2000 and more than double DT FY 1999 level . NIH will focus on studying DT body�s defense mechanisms against TB , and developing and studying NN candidates . Through its Tuberculosis Research Unit , NIH supports an international multi-disciplinary team to translate advances in basic research into JJ tools for fighting TB . • NIH funding for AIDS NN research will increase substantially in FY 2001 and will have more than doubled since FY 1997 . These additional resources will allow NIH to accelerate basic research on developing NN candidates and to significantly expand testing of potential NN candidates in both developing and developed NNS . DT JJ NNP Research Center on DT NIH campus , which will be occupied this summer , will receive a sizeable increase in funding for DT development and pre-clinical testing of HIV NN candidates . • DT Administration is providing strong support for DT path - breaking research on infectious diseases being conducted by U.S. military NNS , including DT opening ( in October 1999 ) of DT Walter Reed Army Institute of Research / Naval NNP Research Center . Working in close collaboration with NNS worldwide , military NNS have developed and tested successful NNS against Japanese encephalitis and hepatitis A � and PRP are working to create NNS and medicines to protect service NNS , travelers , and millions of others from malaria , HIV / AIDS , and other infectious diseases . A JJ Tax Credit MD Effectively Provide Up to $ 1 Billion for Future NN Purchases , Speeding DT Invention and Production of JJ NNS . • Current tax law provides substantial incentives for pharmaceutical research and development , including DT research and experimentation ( R&E ) tax credit , DT orphan drug tax credit , and an enhanced deduction for charitable contributions of certain products . Nonetheless , pharmaceutical companies MD be reluctant to invest in developing NNS for diseases WDT primarily afflict NNS in poor NNS , because little or no paying market exists in those NNS . • Under DT proposal , DT seller of a qualified NN MD claim a tax credit equal to 100 percent of DT amount paid by a qualifying organization WDT received a �credit allocation� by DT U.S. Agency for International Development ( AID ) . DT tax credit MD match DT qualified organizations � expenditures dollar - for - dollar , thereby doubling their purchasing power . A qualifying NN MD be a JJ NN WDT received FDA approval for use against malaria , tuberculosis , HIV / AIDS , or any infectious NN WDT causes over 1 million deaths annually worldwide . • For 2002 through 2010 , AID MD designate up to $ 1 billion of NN sales as eligible for DT credit . This tax credit MD be limited to JJ NNS developed to fight these terrible diseases . DT credit MD provide a specific and credible commitment to purchase future NNS at reasonable prices . Together with similar commitments from foundations and other governments , PRP MD provide a critical and powerful incentive to accelerate NN research and development .

text: DT U.S. NN alone spends $ 200 million a NN on a hunt for a NN against AIDS . At DT forefront of DT search stands Dr. David Baltimore , chairman of DT National Institute of Health's AIDS NNP Research Committee . Currently NN of DT California Institute of Technology as well , Baltimore won DT 1975 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine . Betsey Arledge , producer of DT NOVA film " Surviving AIDS , " interviewed a cautiously optimistic Baltimore on DT current NN of DT search for a NN . NOVA : Can PRP give me a sense of DT magnitude of DT AIDS epidemic at this NN ? Baltimore : DT AIDS epidemic in this country is a serious issue , but it's not a major JJ NN disaster DT way PRP is abroad . In DT NN today EX are something IN 34 million infected NNS , and more NNS are being infected every minute . On DT scale of any JJ NN issue in DT NN , this is CD of DT major ones . EX are more NNS dying of AIDS than of almost any other infectious NN , with tuberculosis and malaria being in DT same ballpark . PRP 's a horrendous situation . ( See AIDS in Perspective . ) NOVA : Do PRP VB PRP 're getting a little complacent in this country ? Baltimore : I 'm impressed IN AIDS remains a very noted NN in DT NNP NNPS . PRP 's noted in DT newspapers all DT NN — what 's VBG on in DT NN and in DT country . EX is very complete coverage of how good DT drugs are and where DT NN program stands . I do n't VB PRP 've allowed PRP to fall off DT radar screen . And PRP do far more AIDS research than DT whole rest of DT NN ; in DT NN area alone , PRP do probably 90 percent of DT research . NOVA : Can PRP give me a sense of DT amount of effort — not just money , but intellectual effort — WDT has gone into trying to find a NN over DT past 10 or 15 NNS ? " She was wrong about DT , but PRP shows IN from DT very first moment a NN was on NNS 's minds . Indeed , EX has been a significant effort to make a NN from DT very first day . Most viruses PRP fight off very well , including polio and even smallpox . A certain fraction of NNS MD be maimed or killed by those viruses , but DT much larger fraction of NNS VBP over them . DT 's not true for H.I.V . PRP knew DT from very early on . But EX 's no certainty IN those are DT key issues . text: A JJ trial has begun in Victoria this week to evaluate a potential NN against NNP - CD . DT NN is called NVX - CoV2373 and is from a NNP biotech company , Novavax . DT trial will be carried out across Melbourne and Brisbane , and is DT first human trial of a NN specifically for NNP - CD to take place in Australia . This NN is actually based on a NN WDT was already in development for influenza . But how might PRP work against SARS - CoV - 2 , DT NN WDT causes NN - CD ? Read more : MD BCG , a 100 - NN - old NN for tuberculosis , protect against NN ? NNS trigger an immune response by introducing DT cells of our immune system to a NN in a safe way , without any exposure to DT pathogen itself . All NNS have to do two things . DT first is make our immune cells bind to and “ eat up ” DT NN . DT second is to activate these immune cells so PRP ’re prepared to fight DT current and any subsequent threats from DT NN in question . PRP often add molecules called adjuvants to NNS to deliver a danger signal to DT immune system , activate immune cells and trigger a strong immune response . Read more : Revealed : DT protein ' spike ' WDT lets DT 2019 - nCoV NN pierce and invade human cells DT Novavax NN is what PRP call a “ subunit ” NN because , instead of delivering DT whole NN , PRP delivers only part of PRP . DT element of SARS - CoV - 2 in this NN is DT spike protein , which is found on DT surface of DT NN . By targeting a particular protein , a subunit NN is a great way to focus DT immune response . However , protein by itself is not very good at binding to and activating DT cells of our immune system . Proteins are generally soluble , which does n’t appeal to immune cells . PRP VBP something PRP can chew on . So instead of soluble protein , Novavax has assembled DT SARS - CoV - 2 spike protein into very small particles , called nanoparticles . To immune cells , these nanoparticles look IN little viruses , so immune cells can bind to these pre-packaged chunks of protein , rapidly engulfing them and becoming activated . DT Novavax NN RB contains an adjuvant called Matrix - M. While DT nanoparticles deliver a modest danger signal , Matrix - M can be added to deliver a much stronger danger signal and really wake up DT immune system . DT Novavax NN for SARS - CoV - 2 is based on a NN DT company was already developing for influenza , called NanoFlu . DT NanoFlu NN contains similar parts – nanoparticles with DT Matrix - M adjuvant . But PRP uses a different protein in DT nanoparticle ( hemagglutinin , which is on DT outside of DT influenza NN ) . In October last NN , Novavax started testing NanoFlu in a phase III clinical trial , DT last level of clinical testing before a NN can be licensed . This trial had 2,650 volunteers and researchers were comparing whether NanoFlu performed as well as Fluzone , a standard influenza NN . Read more : Where are PRP at with developing a NN for NN ? An important feature of this trial is participants were over DT age of 65 . Older NNS tend to have poorer responses to NNS , because immune cells become more difficult to activate as PRP age . This trial is ongoing , with volunteers to be followed until DT end of DT NN . However , early results suggest NanoFlu can generate significantly higher levels of antibodies than Fluzone – even given DT older NNS in DT trial . Antibodies are small proteins made by our immune cells which bind strongly to viruses and can stop them from infecting cells in DT nose and lungs . So increased antibodies with NanoFlu should result in lower rates of infection with influenza . These results were similar to those released after DT phase I trial of NanoFlu , and suggest NanoFlu MD be DT superior NN for influenza . So DT big question is – will DT same strategy work for SARS - CoV -2 ? DT JJ phase I / II trial will enrol around 131 healthy volunteers aged between 18 and 59 to assess DT NN ’s safety and measure how PRP affects DT body ’s immune response . Some volunteers will not receive DT NN , as a placebo control . DT rest will receive DT NN , in a few different forms . DT trial will test two doses of protein nanoparticles – a low ( 5 microgram ) or a high ( 25 microgram ) dose . Both doses will be delivered with Matrix - M adjuvant but DT higher dose will RB be tested without Matrix -M . All groups will receive two shots of DT NN 21 days apart , except CD group WDT will just VB CD shot . This design enables researchers to ask four important questions : • None can DT NN induce an immune response ? • None if so , what dose of nanoparticle is best ? • None do PRP need adjuvant or are nanoparticles enough ? • None do PRP need two shots or is CD enough ? Read more : NN anti-vaxxers are n’t a huge threat yet . How do PRP keep PRP DT way ? While PRP ’s not yet clear how DT NN will perform for SARS - CoV - 2 , Novavax has reported PRP generated strong immune responses in animals . And PRP VBP NanoFlu performed well and had a good safety profile for influenza . NanoFlu RB seemed to work well in older adults , which MD be essential for a NN for NN - CD . PRP eagerly await DT first set of results , expected in a couple of months – an impressive turnaround NN for a clinical trial . If this initial NN is successful , DT phase II portion of DT trial will begin , with more participants . DT Novavax NN joins at least nine other NN candidates for SARS - CoV - 2 currently in clinical testing around DT NN .

text: James Jeffrey " Jeff " Bradstreet ( July 6 , 1954 – June CD , 2015 ) , was an American doctor , alternative medicine practitioner , and a former preacher [ 2 ] who ran DT International Child Development Resource Center in Melbourne , Florida , [ 3 ] a JJ practice in Buford , Georgia [ 4 ] and in Arizona , where he practiced homeopathy . [ 5 ] [ 6 ] He RB founded DT Good NNP Doctor Foundation , which aimed to combine Christian beliefs with his JJ practice . [ 7 ] Bradstreet obtained a Florida JJ license in 1984 . He received a Bachelor of NNP degree from DT University of South Florida in 1976 , where he RB went to JJ school beginning three NNS later . His postgraduate research focused on aerospace medicine , and he received his training in this field from Wilford Hall NNP Center . He was an adjunct professor of child development and neuroscience at DT Southwest College of Naturopathic Medicine in Tempe , Arizona . [ 8 ] Bradstreet published NN research , which he claimed indicated NNS as a cause , in DT Journal of American Physicians and Surgeons , which is not indexed by PubMed . This research claimed IN autistic NNS had a higher body burden of mercury , [ 9 ] and IN three autistic NNS had measles RNA in their cerebrospinal fluid . [ 10 ] DT Institute of Medicine has rejected any relationship between NNS and NN . [ 11 ] Bradstreet treated an autistic child named Colten Snyder ( CD of DT test NNS in DT NN omnibus trial ) with chelation therapy on DT premise of removing mercury from his body , in spite of DT fact IN hair , blood , and urine tests had failed to show he exhibited abnormal levels of mercury . [ 12 ] Over an eight - NN period , Colten visited Bradstreet 's office 160 times . [ 13 ] Stephen Barrett has stated , " PRP appears to me IN Bradstreet decides which of his nonstandard theories to apply and records diagnoses WDT embody them , " and describes Bradstreet 's mercury provoked tests as " phony " . [ 12 ] Peter Hotez characterized Bradstreet 's proposal to treat NN with chelation therapy as " dangerous . " [ 6 ] In an interview with DT Chicago Tribune , Bradstreet defended DT use of intravenous immunoglobulin ( IVIG ) as an NN treatment , saying , " Every kid with NN should have a trial of IVIG if money was not an option and IVIG was abundant . " [ 14 ] Bradstreet RB published research regarding DT use of hyperbaric oxygen therapy for NN , [ 15 ] some of which concluded PRP was ineffective , [ 16 ] as well as a paper arguing IN autistic NNS have an increased vulnerability to oxidative stress . [ 17 ] Further treatments Bradstreet used on autistic NNS included DT controversial protein GcMAF , with which he claimed to have treated 600 NNS . [ 18 ] In an article for an anti-vaccine magazine , Bradstreet endorsed stem cell therapy as an NN treatment . [ CD ] Bradstreet was found dead from a gunshot wound to DT chest in DT Broad River in Rutherford County , North Carolina in June 2015 , after his Buford , Georgia JJ office was raided by DT FDA in connection with an investigation into GcMAF treatments . [ 4] [ 20 ] [ 21 ] At DT NN of his death , he lived in Braselton and ran his JJ practice in Buford . Religious exemptions allow parents to opt their NNS out of mandated NN policies if PRP object to DT NN for religious reasons and if PRP follow DT NN ’s opt - out process . Instead , PRP can include exemptions for conscience or moral ideology . DT measles outbreak in DT NNP York suburb of Rockland County has largely been cantered in an ultra-Orthodox Jewish community , where EX has been some recent resistance to vaccinations . NN rates tend to be low among DT ultra-Orthodox , and DT reasons vary , from fear of interference from outsiders to confusion over accurate religious and JJ information . text: Following DT recent terror attack in Manchester , Theresa NNP is urging G7 Leaders to tackle Online extremism . DT question is , what is deemed extremism ? DT G7 backed Mrs NNP ’s call for more pressure to be put on internet companies such as Google , Facebook and Twitter to target extremist messages online . This will include developing technology which automatically identifies and removes messages WDT incite violence ….. DT G7 will support DT creation of an international industry - led forum to develop and share tools of this type , she VBD . Of course by extremism PRP are referring to ISIS and DT radicalisation of young muslim men , well at least DT is what PRP are led to believe is their purpose for such measures . But in reality this is not just about ISIS , in fact PRP has nothing whatsoever to do with ISIS . Last week PRP reported how Theresa NNP proposed to ‘ Govern DT Internet ’ in order to control explicit material : Then a few days later PRP have DT Manchester Suicide bomber Salman Abedi , allegedly kill 22 NNS and injure JJ others . DT last few terror attacks in Europe have raised questions over Encrypted messaging applications such as Whatsapp , with NNP leaders demanding IN Whatapp developers integrate backdoor access for intelligence agents : This is nothing more than DT take down of DT Internet as PRP VBP PRP . DT ability to share information about DT murderous governments ruling our NN is doing far to much damage to DT Elites agenda . ‘ Extremism ’ comes in JJ forms , from Western NNP backed Jihadist ’s brainwashing young Muslims to join their club , to Anarchist ’s IN ourselves who expose DT corrupt NN ’s running DT NNP . Arguing IN PRP do n’t care about DT right to privacy because PRP have nothing to hide is no different than saying PRP do n’t care about free speech because PRP have nothing to say .

text: Legendary gold and market expert Jim Sinclair says DT NN WDT originated in NNP MD have , oddly enough , done some good . Sinclair explains , “ DT effect of DT NN was literally to shut down business globally , therefore , shut off DT demand for loans , which RB shut off demand for short term money . So , what DT NN has not seen , is not considering and does not understand is PRP were stepping into DT door of a major financial crisis magnitudes larger than what happened in 2008 and 2009 . PRP ’s a horrible thing WDT this NN occurred , but if PRP had not occurred , PRP MD have been in a crisis much more serious than 2008 and 2009 . . . . PRP was blowing sky high . . . . Shutting down demand is all PRP MD do . PRP stopped DT explosion of interest rates . ” Where do PRP VB from here ? Sinclair says , “ PRP are VBG to make a recovery . PRP ’s not VBG to be a ‘ V ’ by any means . DT stock market MD be a ‘ V ’ because DT stock market has very little to do with reality . . . . As far as business is concerned , very serious damage has been done to DT infrastructure to DT business equation . JJ employers are gone . JJ corporations have significant readjustments to be able to build up again . DT supply lines and logistics , where did everything come from ? NNP . . . . This is a major worldwide adjustment , both economically and politically . . . . PRP had everything made in DT cheapest place possible . . . . This is not a passing phenomenon . . . . DT only thing WDT has been steady is gold . . . . DT NN WDT this brings about is a reconstruction of DT basic business foundations . PRP ’s a start over , PRP ’s not just a slowdown . How JJ restaurants make money on 50 % of DT clients ? PRP can ’t . How JJ automobiles have built up on DT lots ? Enormous amounts . How JJ clothing stores shut down full of winter clothes and ca n’t make DT shift to summer wear ? PRP can VB down DT entire line . So , this recovery will be more IN an ‘ L ’ . PRP ’ve come straight down , and PRP are VBG to VB sideways now . . . . JJ businesses are not VBG to open up again . . . . DT idea of DT coming inflation as a result of this is simple . Everything WDT PRP need will VB up in price . Everything PRP do n’t need is not VBG to hold value . PRP are better off with a freezer full of fine cuts of beef than PRP are with a brand JJ Tesla . DT beef will VB up in price , DT Tesla will VB down . ” On gold , Sinclair says DT ultimate price is an easy - to - calculate math problem . How much gold does America have compared to how much debt PRP has ? So , how high MD gold ultimately VB ? Sinclair says , “ PRP ’s simple math . PRP take DT amount of gold DT U.S. says PRP has , and then PRP take DT debt PRP has , and what price MD PRP need for DT debt to balance to zero ? DT price on DT low end is $ 50,000 per ounce . DT true price is $ 87,500 per ounce . ” Is a biblical debt jubilee coming to America ? Sinclair says , “ PRP already have jubilees . If PRP do n’t pay your rent , PRP have a jubilee . If PRP do n’t pay your student loan , PRP have a jubilee . If DT payment of your auto insurance is postponed , PRP have a jubilee . PRP ’ve got jubilee after jubilee after jubilee . RB , keep in mind , DT NNS who are n’t being paid are being hurt very badly . ” Sinclair thinks DT recovery will take a decade or longer , and Sinclair says , “ PRP will be just IN DT period between 1929 up to WWII ( 1941 ) . ” Join Greg Hunter as he goes CD - on - CD with renowned gold expert Jim Sinclair . text: DT measles outbreaks continue to spread , with NNP York City declaring a JJ NN emergency and requiring NNS in four ZIP codes to have their NNS vaccinated or face penalties , including a fine of NNP $ 1,000 and or imprisonment . Since September 2018 , 285 measles NNS have been reported in Brooklyn and Queens , mainly in neighborhoods where ultra-Orthodox Jews have chosen to not have their NNS vaccinated . DT Centers for NNP Control and Prevention , VBD IN from Jan. 1 to April 4 , 2019 , 465 individual NNS of measles have been confirmed in CD NNS . NNS have still been occurring each NN , often brought into DT NNP NNPS from international travelers . But EX are limits to what NN care providers , JJ NN officials and legislators can do . PRP is crucial to consider both DT power – and DT limits – of potential solutions WDT will provide education , JJ care and protection for DT NN while still upholding principles of informed consent , parental decision - making and sustaining JJ trust . As a professor who researches and teaches NN law , JJ NN law and JJ ethics , I VBP PRP ’s worth clarifying what NNS can or cannot legally do when responding to NNS of communicable NN . DT law recognizes DT right of an individual to refuse JJ interventions . NN law has a strong history of recognizing bodily integrity : Adults can choose whether to accept or reject a proposed JJ intervention , even in instances where JJ NN authorities conclude a NN MD benefit both DT individual and society . DT Supreme Court has recognized parents ’ ability to direct DT care and control of their NNS , including consenting or forgoing JJ treatment for their child except in very specific circumstances . In DT 1905 Jacobson v. Massachusetts case , DT Supreme Court upheld a NN law delegating power to local NN officials mandating IN adults receive CD smallpox NN in DT midst of an epidemic or pay a fine ( about $ 130 today ) . Under DT concept of police power , NNS have a duty to enact laws WDT promote DT NN , safety and welfare of its residents . JJ NN authorities MD offer NNS as a method of prevention , but JJ professionals , JJ NN authorities and even courts MD not legally compel a person to submit to a NN . DT Jacobson decision RB set forth limits on police power , yet subsequent NNS addressing NN mandates discarded these requirements , extending multiple NN mandates to school attendance for NN not in circulation and in DT absence of an epidemic . Deferring to respected scientific consensus as a means to justify forced JJ interventions in DT name of individual benefit and DT JJ good has historically resulted in some of DT most egregious constitutional and human rights atrocities in DT U.S . DT mass forcible sterilization during DT eugenics movement is but CD example . DT history of NN and medicine further demonstrates DT fallibility of commonly accepted JJ knowledge , such as when Bayer introduced heroin as a safe , non-addictive substitute for morphine , or physicians prescribed Bendectin and thalidomide to relieve nausea , only to find these medications resulted in babies born with severe birth defects . DT law is RB quite clear IN JJ NN authorities and law enforcement MD place restrictions on a person ’s individual liberty – including religious liberty – in situations where a person ’s actions pose a direct , immediate and compelling harm to others , such as using venomous snakes in religious worship or asserting a nonexistent “ right ” to use an illegal substance such as marijuana when operating a motor vehicle . In JJ NN law relating to communicable NN , this constitutes a very specific standard : A person must have a present NN , and this person ’s actions must pose a direct threat to others . For example , NN officials MD seek a quarantine order or civil commitment for a person with active tuberculosis who continues to frequent highly populated JJ spaces until DT person is no longer contagious . Even in such a case , NN authorities can offer treatment and limit a person ’s movement to prevent infecting others , but DT law does not permit forcibly medicating a competent person against his will . Accordingly , legal precedent does not support quarantining vast geographic areas of healthy persons who have not been exposed to DT communicable illness , but MD support tailored voluntary isolation and quarantine of persons who have been exposed to , or currently have , DT illness . What NN officials can do to protect NNS DT CDC classifies NNS as CD of DT top 10 JJ NN achievements . DT vast majority ( about 98 % ) of parents across DT U.S. as a whole comply with DT NN law mandated schedule of NNS for their NNS . NNS , IN any other FDA - approved product such as a prescription drug or JJ device , carry a set of risks and benefits . These calculations vary depending on DT NN , its efficacy , safety , potential side effects , DT severity of DT illness DT NN aims to protect against , and DT individual to whom PRP is administered . To promote NN for NNS , NN officials MD offer educational campaigns and set up free clinics for parents to bring their NNS . NN laws MD RB mandate NNS as a condition for school attendance , or require excluding unvaccinated NNS during an active outbreak at their school . However , if NNS offer a religious or nonmedical exemption , courts have been clear IN NN officials and school officials do not have discretion to require DT child ’s parent to identify with an organized religion or reject DT sincerity of DT parent ’s beliefs because this violates DT First Amendment . JJ NN professionals worry IN parents who forgo NN are placing their child and DT community at risk . Some have advocated IN DT NN should step in with coercive measures such as eliminating any nonmedical exemptions for all NNS or intervene by force , such as classifying parents ’ decision as child neglect or seeking a court order to vaccinate DT child . In my opinion , these strategies rely on a distortion of legal precedent , dismiss longstanding authority of parents to make decisions for their NNS , and threaten to undermine an already fractured JJ trust . NN JJ NN officials have DT duty to protect residents from illness and communicable NN , but these strategies must fall within appropriate legal parameters . text: After NNS of deflection and foot - dragging , DT major tech companies are finally having to take steps toward policing their own content . But now PRP have VBN , for a brief moment at least , against a major NN theorist . Facebook , Apple , YouTube and Spotify have all taken action against Alex Jones . Both Facebook and Twitter have both grappled with incidents of discrimination against conservatives , which MD have made them gun-shy about banning ( as opposed to shadow - banning ) some folks . But almost in unison , DT tech giants teamed up against Jones , who runs Infowars . text: This article is more than 3 NNS old . Bullshit , James Ball tells me , can VB PRP into DT Oval Office . DT former Guardian journalist and now special correspondent at BuzzFeed is well versed in separating fact from fiction . As a young reporter fresh out of university he started as an intern at WikiLeaks , working on DT verification and publication of confidential NNP documents in 2010 , and then on DT Snowden leaks in 2013 during his NN at DT Guardian . DT ’s all to say he ’s developed a sixth sense for what is , and is n’t , bullshit . With this in mind , today Ball is publishing his debut book as a solo author on DT fake NN phenomenon which has engulfed DT NN of politics over DT last NN . PRP sat down with Ball to find out how half - truths , untruths and outright fakery took over : Fake NN , post - truths and bullshit , is this a JJ phenomenon ? This definitely is n't JJ : newspapers have run questionable stories for as long as PRP 've existed , and fake NN has circulated DT web for just as long . But things have changed a bit – fake NN got political last NN , because DT was DT way to VB huge audiences . So PRP 's some old trends WDT have suddenly really come to DT fore . So who 's to blame for fake NN ? Russia ! More seriously – all of PRP . Fake NN is just DT most visible bit of what is a whole ecosystem of half - truths , untruths and outright fakery , or in other words , of bullshit . When PRP share a story without thinking about PRP or checking , PRP 're part of DT system . When a hyper - partisan NN site ( VB Breitbart or DT Canary ) over - hypes and spins a kernel of truth into something much bigger , DT 's part of PRP . When mainstream outlets run too - good - to - check stories , PRP 're part of PRP . And when Facebook and others profit off this whole system , PRP 're part of PRP too . Are EX examples of fake NN causing real harm ? DT Pizzagate NN – an alt - right theory IN pizza parlours were harbouring secret child abuse sites used by leading democrats – led to an armed man storming a DC pizza parlour . So DT consequences of this stuff can be very real . Polling shows Republicans believe Obama wiretapped NNP ( EX 's no evidence he did ) , while JJ Democrats believe NNP election machines themselves were hacked ( EX 's no evidence of this either ) . When PRP all believe different facts , PRP can't have a JJ conversation – PRP can only have a shouting match . So what 's DT solution ? Will PRP ever be free of fake NN ? DT upside of all of PRP being part of DT problem is IN PRP can all be part of DT solution . PRP need to find ways to make corrections reach as JJ NNS as DT initial bad reports and hoaxes do . PRP 've got to find JJ ways to cover politicians and campaigns which deploy bullshit to win . EX 's no CD big fix , but EX 's lots of little things all of PRP can do . DT fightback can start whenever PRP VBP . Post - Truth : How Bullshit Conquered DT NNP is available now on Kindle and in paperback . This article originally appeared on DT Memo

text: Picture adult engagement with information as a continuum . On CD side sits intentional ( or actively sought ) information , and on DT other lives seemingly incidental ( or passively received ) information ( see Figure 1 ) . In this section , PRP address DT two ends of this continuum and then discuss DT space in between . Our continuum is based entirely on work in schools and with teachers ; however , a reviewer of earlier drafts of this article pointed PRP to Ross 's ( 1999 ) concept of finding without seeking , which led PRP to Williamson 's ( 1998 ) article , which distinguished incidental information acquisition from purposeful information seeking . These older studies serve to remind PRP IN DT concepts employed here are not JJ , although DT ubiquity , speed , and scale of information encountered in DT age of DT internet is . Educators need to address these challenges , but where are PRP to begin ? As part of DT SHEG ( 2016 ) NN , DT researchers compared DT way students approached judging credibility with DT way professional fact ‐checkers approached DT same tasks ( Wineburg & McGrew , 2016 ) . This is an interesting and important line of research , partly because PRP compares various kinds of readers and reading purposes and partly because PRP grows from an authentic example of adult interaction with text . PRP RB see value in exploring DT relation between identity and information seeking ( Kohnen , in press ) and wonder how schools might design learning environments where students not only learn fact ‐checking skills but RB learn to value facts . DT utility of DT rules for internet searching WDT are currently and commonly taught is suspect given DT range of topics likely addressed in DT upper left quadrant of Figure 2 . When querying settled issues WDT are uncontroversial , DT rules MD make some sense . However , DT issues WDT fall into DT upper left quadrant are often those WDT are most controversial or otherwise unsettled . DT more current DT question is , DT less likely NN is to find peer ‐reviewed research on PRP ; library NNS have described this as DT information cycle . Navigating DT digital floodwaters is perhaps most treacherous when users are in unsettled territory , but if educators are to prepare students for authentic , intentional searching , is n't PRP their responsibility to help students gather information about unsettled topics ? DT high ‐stakes searches should be a high priority for schools , but DT small amount of information ‐seeking instruction currently occurring appears to be almost exclusively focused on preparing students for searches WDT fall into DT upper right quadrant of Figure 2 . Clearly , students should be exposed to what PRP means to search IN an expert and should learn to use specific websites WDT historians , NNS , literary critics , or mathematicians find highly credible . Yet , should this be DT only kind of information ‐seeking instruction WDT students receive ? After all , DT upper left quadrant of Figure 2 ( “ highly important / low preparation ” ) is a place where PRP will all find ourselves at CD point or another in our lives . Questions related to citizenship , personal finance , NN , and consumer decisions MD all fall into this quadrant . Again , based on surveys and conversations with adults of all ages , PRP conclude IN most NNS engage in intentional information seeking of all kinds at CD point or another . Examples from Angela 's perspective are included in Figure 2 for illustrative purposes , and PRP have invited dozens of adults to VB about their recent information ‐seeking endeavors in these terms . PRP hope IN this graphic will help start a conversation about what PRP means to prepare students to be successful in different kinds of searches . In all likelihood , educators will see DT low ‐stakes searches as a low priority for schools ; perhaps teachers might model via a search ‐aloud ( Saul , Kohnen , Newman , & Pearce , 2012 ) how PRP engage in low ‐stakes searches of different kinds , but otherwise these kinds of searches probably demand little curricular space . However , DT internet ‐searching rules imposed by JJ teachers do little to prepare students for DT daily information needs of adults , needs WDT are not primarily academic or even career in nature . In fact , DT banned resources are DT bedrock of JJ of DT searches WDT adults engage in as parents , moviegoers , hobbyists , and so forth ( for more on Wikipedia , see Alvermann , 2017 ) . PRP propose thinking about these needs in terms of two variables : importance ( Is DT information need high or low stakes ? ) and preparation ( How well has your education and / or experience prepared PRP to deal with DT information PRP find ? ; see Figure 2 ) . Searches undertaken in schools appear to be designed to help students succeed in formal academic environments . If DT goal of schools is to prepare students to succeed as academics in training , PRP might make sense to ban Wikipedia ; after all , academics do not usually cite tertiary sources such as Wikipedia in their formal writing . Likewise , perhaps teachers privilege .gov and .edu domain names because PRP associate these domains with an editorial process , and some teachers MD encourage students to VB to DT databases in an attempt to steer them toward peer ‐reviewed resources . PRP appears IN most teachers recognize how difficult navigating DT digital floodwaters is for students and believe IN rules are needed as basic signposts or clues . Yet , these rules do not teach students to assess DT credibility of online information as a nuanced or critical thinking activity . Instead , these inflexible rules mask differences between websites WDT MD have a similar domain name or DT same suffix ; do not account for DT various kinds of information WDT exist online ( e.g. , blogs , newspapers , magazines , commercial product sites , professional and amateur videos ) ; and privilege academic searches over other kinds of information seeking , as PRP discuss next . Since 2009 , PRP have been collecting survey , focus group , and interview data on DT ways WDT students are being taught to access information online . PRP have RB talked informally with teachers as part of other projects WDT take PRP into schools . Our respondents came from urban , suburban , and rural upper elementary , middle , and high school classrooms ( grades 4 – 12 ) in schools in DT U.S. Midwest and Southeast . PRP RB discussed internet searching with a group of college students at a highly selective university ( see Kohnen & Saul , 2017 ) . Based on several hundred responses , DT following trends became apparent : Compounding DT problem , high ‐stakes tests , including NN tests such as those developed by Smarter Balanced and DT Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers , as well as college entrance exams such as DT SAT and ACT , do not currently demand IN students find their own information . Rather , tests are scored on students ' ability to read provided texts and cite relevant details from those texts in a coherent essay WDT answers someone else 's question . In this environment , PRP have even heard principals characterize student curiosity as a potential distraction WDT must be managed . In sum , DT answer to DT question about whether DT curriculum allots space and NN for students ' own queries and curiosities is often no or at least not enough . Since DT Common Core NNP Standards ( National Governors Association Center for Best Practices & Council of Chief NNP School Officers , 2010 ) were unveiled , schools across DT NNP NNPS have devoted more NN to informational and other kinds of nonfiction texts ( see RB DT National Assessment of Educational Progress frameworks , on which DT Common Core 's reading and writing distributions were based ) . However , as noted earlier , these texts are typically teacher selected or curriculum dictated , with little input or effort on DT part of students . Surely , teaching students to read and engage with complex nonfiction is a challenging task , and working with class texts MD be a necessary or effective way to introduce certain skills or engage in whole ‐group discussions . Yet , without NN and space to explore their own questions and curiosities , students have little chance to practice their intentional information ‐seeking skills in personal and motivating contexts . Understandably , teachers express worry IN DT curriculum is already too crowded ; DT unpredictability of student ‐driven information seeking MD feel , in CD teacher 's words , “ just too hard . ” As this list makes clear , DT information sought MD be serious or trivial , uncontested or complex . Because intentional information acquisition implies action ( from finding directions to choosing a diet plan to deciding how to vote ) , PRP RB involves skills : DT skills to seek , find , assess , and comprehend a wide variety of texts ( often in a variety of modalities ) . Curriculum developers have deemed some information important and purposefully ignored other informational needs . For instance , few teachers teach or grade a young person 's ability to follow a baseball team 's efforts , even though PRP MD recognize this effort as useful , engaging , and perhaps even wholesome . At DT other end of DT information –acquisition continuum sits incidental information , DT information WDT PRP are all exposed to on a near ‐constant basis . DT term incidental seems to imply IN information is simply sprayed about and hits some of PRP . This is , to a limited extent , DT case : An airport blasts PRP with television NN , and a YouTube video is available only if CD first watches an advertisement . Other forms of incidental information are targeted based on who PRP is ( e.g. , DT targeted ads and articles WDT pop up on our computer screens ) , where CD lives , or what PRP does . Regardless of why this non‐sought ‐out information comes to PRP , DT amount of incidental information WDT PRP encounter is astounding , as recent studies have estimated ( see Bohn & Short , 2012 ; Short , 2013 ) . Schools have historically sought to ignore incidental information , despite DT fact IN PRP composes a huge proportion of DT information diet . Yet , to bring incidental information and ideas thoughtfully into DT curriculum , educators need to recognize first IN incidental information is , in fact , a fund of knowledge . Until incidental information is recognized as such , educators will not be able to analyze its sources , its effects , or its role in students ' lives . JJ scholars have discussed DT disconnect between home and school literacies , particularly for students whose home cultures do not align with DT culture represented by their school ( e.g. , Heath , 1983 ; Moje , Ciechanowski , & Kramer , 2004 ) . In this same sense , PRP is important to note IN incidental information should be considered a literacy WDT MD or MD not align with school discourse . Imagine DT information WDT students are exposed to as part of their everyday , out ‐of ‐school lives through no seemingly active effort on their part : television and radio programs ; websites WDT happen to be up on a computer or tablet when a student sits down to play or work with PRP ; physical copies of magazines , newspapers , and books in DT home ; and automatic texts or RSS feeds WDT appear on a phone or in an e‐mail inbox . These sources often RB inspire adult conversations WDT students MD join or simply overhear . More important perhaps is DT information picked up in dinnertime conversations or on outings with family members or friends . DT sheer amount of incidental information WDT students are exposed to outside of school MD be a critical component of school success . In studies WDT focused on physical resources , Neuman and Celano ( 2001 ) and Neuman and Moland ( 2016 ) found socioeconomic differences in access to print for very young NNS , with NNS in low ‐income neighborhoods having fewer print resources available . Neuman and Moland coined DT term book deserts to describe DT lack of physical books in areas of concentrated poverty . PRP suspect IN EX MD be similar differences in DT amount of incidental information WDT students are exposed to outside of schools and , surely , differences in DT types and sources of such information , such as DT kinds of books , magazines , and newspapers in DT home ; access to high ‐speed internet and DT technologies to take advantage of PRP ; and adult conversations around incidental information . In other words , experiences with incidental information often help students do better ( or worse ) in schools . DT issue here is CD of alignment . Although DT amount and content of incidental information WDT young NNS are exposed to MD differ across socioeconomic classes , a proposition WDT PRP have not investigated , all residents living in DT NNP NNPS in DT 21st century are exposed to a great deal of incidental information . Yet , when incidental information aligns nicely with DT discourses of school , DT bar for learning JJ information in school is relatively low . However , when DT incidental information to which students are exposed ( perhaps because of class , culture , neighborhood , or other reasons ) is quite different from or at odds with school discourses , DT bar for school success is much higher . VBN differently , experiences with incidental information likely make school harder or easier for students . In contrast to a deficit model of thinking , Moll and colleagues ( e.g. , Moll , 2015 ; Moll , Amanti , Neff , & Gonzalez , 1992 ) focused on resource ‐based pedagogy , a way of teaching WDT builds on what students , families , and communities VBP ( i.e. , their funds of knowledge ) . Inspired by Moll , PRP ask , How might incidental information be considered a fund of knowledge ? How might teachers learn what incidental information makes up DT backdrop of their students ' lives and use this information as a resource for teaching ? From a student perspective and by our own definition of non‐sought ‐out knowledge , DT school curriculum often , if not always , focuses on incidental information . DT curriculum is typically determined by someone else and is presented to students with very little , if any , input on their part . Even when students are in classrooms WDT promote active learning , DT activity is almost always focused on learning predetermined concepts about predetermined topics ; as noted earlier , in JJ schools , very little NN is dedicated to students ' own curiosities and queries . However , CD of DT gifts of an exceptional teacher is DT ability to inspire students to move from passive information acquisition to active , intentional information seeking , often about topics WDT DT students never considered before . Curricular units almost always start with students in a passive role in terms of topic , concept , or information to be learned ; DT is , although PRP MD be engaged in active learning , PRP usually have not selected DT curriculum itself . Yet , through DT guidance of a teacher , students can take an active interest in finding out more . For example , Wendy ( second author ) recently witnessed an upper elementary NN teacher teaching a unit on animals native to DT NN . Inspired by their teacher 's enthusiasm , students eagerly researched a bird and wrote individual entries for a class book on “ what makes native birds cool . ” PRP doubt IN JJ of DT students in this class MD have chosen to seek out bird information on their own prior to their teacher 's invitation , but PRP found her enthusiasm and deep interest in their research irresistible . PRP suggest IN our continuum of information acquisition MD be useful for teachers as PRP VBP about DT curriculum from DT perspective of their students . Engaging students in active learning is not a JJ concept , of course , but DT intentional end of DT continuum is specifically about active seeking , not just activity in terms of classroom talk or movement . Our respect and even love for education was built on DT efforts of influential teachers who inspired PRP to VB to VB more about a topic previously viewed as foreign and perhaps even boring . Although such engagement likely cannot happen for every student during every unit , including more opportunities for active , intentional information seeking on curricular topics is a reasonable goal . Finally , PRP wonder how schools can equip students to recognize and respond appropriately when incidental information is a distraction . Today , adults and NNS alike struggle to manage DT onslaught of incidental information . Incidental information , in DT form of background radio or television programs or DT constant influx of e‐mail and text messages , is ubiquitous . Images of couples staring at screens rather than making conversation and parents pushing NNS on swings while checking their phones have become cliché , but PRP RB represent a frightening reality . Our students today live with a 24 ‐ hour NN cycle WDT must manufacture NN to fill airtime ; JJ RB believe in DT myth of multitasking and attempt to do homework while clicking back and forth among multiple information feeds . Learning to shut down or limit DT flow of incidental information , or at least judge when PRP is worthy of attention , MD be an overlooked 21st ‐century literacy skill .

text: Move over , pizza rat . DT internet has a JJ hero , and it's a pizza - eating man who hilariously photobombed a reporter on air . A video VBG viral with over a million views on Twitter shows a congressional staffer in DT NNP unintentionally photobombing a CBSN reporter while eating pizza - and DT Internet is loving PRP . According to Mediaite , DT video was shot while DT reporter was covering former Donald NNP attorney Michael Cohen 's testimony on Wednesday afternoon . In DT video , as he speaks on camera , a congressional staffer behind him in DT hallway proceeds to take a big bite out of his pizza . DT short clip captures DT moment ' Hallway pizza guy ' realises he's in DT shot - and PRP will make PRP laugh out loud . Netizens have n't stopped laughing at DT hilarious photobomb since PRP was shared online . See some of DT best reactions below : DT video even earned DT photobomber a loving nickname : Hallway pizza guy This is n't DT first NN an unsuspecting NN anchor has been photobombed on air . Last NN , a scarlet bird landed on a reporter 's head during a live broadcast , and DT hilarious footage went viral .

text: U.S. NNP - elect Donald NNP returned Tuesday to his vision of a non-interventionist foreign policy for DT NNP NNPS , saying , as he did during his campaign , IN he does not VB American forces fighting " in areas WDT PRP should n't be fighting in . text: Use of color - coded bandannas in DT gay and BDSM communities DT handkerchief code ( RB known as DT hanky code , DT bandana code , and flagging [ 1 ] ) is a color - coded system , employed usually among DT gay male casual - sex seekers or BDSM practitioners in DT NNP NNPS , Canada , Australia and Europe , to indicate preferred sexual fetishes , what kind of sex PRP are seeking , and whether PRP are a top / dominant or bottom / submissive . Wearing a handkerchief on DT left side of DT body typically indicates PRP is a " top " ( CD considered active in DT practice of DT act / fetish indicated by DT color of DT handkerchief ) , while wearing PRP on DT right side of DT body MD indicate CD is a " bottom " ( CD considered passive in DT practice of DT act / fetish indicated by DT color of DT handkerchief ) . DT hanky code was widely used in DT 1970s by gay and bisexual men . DT wearing of various colored bandanas around DT neck was common in DT mid- and late - nineteenth century among cowboys , steam railroad engineers , and miners in DT Western NNP NNPS . PRP is thought IN DT wearing of bandanas by gay men originated in San Francisco after DT Gold Rush , when , because of a shortage of women , men dancing with each other in square dances developed a code wherein DT man wearing DT blue bandana took DT male part in DT square dance , and DT man wearing DT red bandana took DT female part ( these bandanas were usually worn around DT arm or hanging from DT belt or in DT back pocket of PRP 's jeans ) . [ 2 ] PRP is thought IN DT modern hanky code started in NNP York City in late 1970 or early 1971 when a journalist for DT Village Voice joked IN instead of simply wearing keys to indicate whether someone was a " top " or a " bottom " , PRP MD be more efficient to subtly announce their particular sexual focus by wearing different colored hankies . [ 3 ] Other sources attribute DT expansion of DT original red–blue system into today 's code to marketing efforts around 1971 by DT San Francisco department store for erotic merchandise , DT Trading Post , promoting handkerchiefs by printing cards listing DT meanings of various colors . [ 4 ] Alan Selby , founder of Mr. S Leather in San Francisco , claimed IN he created DT first hanky code with his business partners at Leather ' n ' Things in 1972 , when their bandana supplier inadvertently doubled their order and DT expanded code MD help them sell DT extra colors PRP had received . [ 5 ] Bob Damron 's Address Book is RB notable when referencing DT Handkerchief Code . Starting in 1964 , a businessman by DT name of Bob Damron published a book of all DT gay bars he knew from his constant travels across DT NNP NNPS . “ This book fit comfortably in DT palm of your hand , ” a description reads . “ Despite its petite size , this book was an impressive accomplishment . Each CD of DT listings he had visited himself . Every last copy of DT book he sold himself . ” [ 2 ] Bob Damron 's Address Book RB published a yearly chart for DT meaning of each colored hanky under DT title " COLOR CODES " . [ 2 ] This table is drawn from Larry Townsend 's DT Leatherman 's Handbook II ( DT 1983 second edition ; DT 1972 first edition did not include this list ) and is generally considered authoritative . Implicit in this list is DT concept of left / right polarity , left as usual indicating DT top , dominant , or active partner ; right DT bottom , submissive , or passive partner . Negotiation with a prospective partner remains important because , as Townsend noted , NNS MD wear hankies of any color " only because DT idea of DT hankie turns them on " or " MD not even VB what PRP means " . [ 6 ] DT longer lists found on DT web are more elaborate and DT JJ color codes in them are less often used in practice , although some of these colors are offered for sale at LGBT stores along with free cards listing their meanings . While DT hankie code was a semiotic system of sexual advertising popular among DT gay leather community of DT NNP NNPS [ 7 ] , PRP is no longer as popular in DT modern day era . PRP MD be seen as something kinkier to use in gay pornography , or at sex and fetish events IN DT Folsom Street Fair . Social networks MD have replaced DT use of hankies in cruising areas by digitizing DT process . By using online platforms , men who have sex with men ( MSM ) can eliminate harassment and violence WDT PRP MD face in NN . [ 8 ] Social networks for MSM RB allow for sub - groups , and for NNS to list fetishes , and what PRP are looking for , which is where DT replacement of DT need for hankies MD have come from . [ 8 ] Grindr is DT most popular app for MSM who use social networks for cruising , with an average of 1.3 hours per day spent on DT app per user . [ 9 ] • None Jacques , Trevor H. ( 1993 ) . On DT Safe Edge : A Manual for SM Play . Toronto : Whole SM Publishing . ISBN .
